channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gold Rises in Likely Technical Recovery
item.description: Gold rose in early Asian trade in a likely technical recovery. Gold ended Friday’s trading with largest weekly price drop since March 2020.

item.title: ‘I can’t deal with managing them’: I juggle 18 credit cards. How do I close them without ruining my credit score?
item.description: “I have very high limits, so charges barely make a blip on my credit-utilization ratio.”

item.title: Stock-market investors cheered end of election uncertainty. Policy uncertainty remains.
item.description: Investors asked themselves whether the postelection rally could continue, and if Trump is really as good for the market as some think.

item.title: Nikkei Down 1.1%, Dragged by Chip, Defense Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks declined as uncertainty continues over the pace of U.S. monetary-policy easing.

item.title: Oil Mixed as Concerns of Weak China Demand Persist
item.description: Oil prices were mixed in early Asian trade as market sentiment was weighed by persistent concerns of weak demand in China.

item.title: Yen Weakens After BOJ's Ueda Avoids Signaling Rate Hike in December
item.description: Yen weakened against other G-10 and Asian currencies as Bank of Japan Gov. Ueda avoided signaling a rate hike in December.

item.title: ‘I opt to fly private — no matter what the cost’: The caviar in first class tastes like burnt plastic. What ever happened to airline standards?
item.description: “I truly feel sorry for the poor souls who are subjected to these kinds of horrors.”

item.title: JGBs Mixed; Focus on BOJ Ueda's Speech
item.description: JGBs were mixed in the morning Tokyo session, tracking the mixed performance of U.S. Treasurys on Friday.

item.title: ‘I became very frugal’: My husband and I are 40. I have $200,000 in student debt, while he has $600,000 in retirement savings. Are we in trouble?
item.description: “Neither of us will have an inheritance and everything we have, we built together.”

item.title: The Fed interrupted the stock market’s Trump rally. What comes next?
item.description: The stock market rally takes a breather. Now it’s at the mercy of the bond market as investors weigh Donald Trump’s economic plans and what they mean ...
